channel.title: God is real
channel.description:
1. Babies. I watched my wife give birth to our four daughters, and last month I visited my new grandson. I’ve stared at little Zalahriqe’s cute face and tiny fingers—and the cleft in his chin that resembles mine. How can anyone deny the reality of God when they see a baby? The amount of information encrypted in one cell in the human body is equal to that of 1,000 books. The total amount of information stored in your DNA is 40 times more than that of the largest set of encyclopedias in the world. King David felt this sense of awe when he wrote, “You wove me in my mother’s womb. ... I am fearfully and wonderfully made” (Ps. 139:13, 14, NASB). Life is truly a miracle!
2. Thunderstorms. I love to sit on my back porch in Florida and listen to the rumbling of thunder. It reminds me of God’s majesty and power. The apostle Paul said creation was the best evidence of God’s existence. He wrote, “For since the creation of the world His invisible attributes, His eternal power and divine nature, have been clearly seen” (Rom. 1:20). Nature is actually full of quantifiable miracles. Just consider the fact that the earth is the perfect distance from the sun to support life. If we were any farther away from the sun, we would freeze; if we were even slightly closer to it, we would burn up. It’s obvious God created this home for us!
3. Flowers. There are more than 400,000 species of flowers in the world, and most of them are not edible. Their job is to simply make the world beautiful. Did they just haphazardly evolve over time, or did a loving God create each individual shape and color scheme for our enjoyment? People who choose to deny God don’t spend enough time looking at tulips, snapdragons, orchids, lilies, lotuses or magnolias. This is why it’s really important to stop and smell the roses!
4. The Bible. Paul wrote that “all Scripture is inspired by God” (2 Tim. 3:16). The Bible itself is proof of God’s existence because He used 40 unrelated people over a period of 2,000 years to write His unique love letter to us. There is nothing like the Bible because it carries the same consistent message throughout all of its 66 different books. Atheists can laugh at this idea, but those who have read the Scriptures and experienced God through its pages know why it is the best-selling and most-translated book in all of history. (Fact: 100 million copies of the Bible are sold every year. Richard Dawkins’ The God Delusion has sold 2 million.)
5. The global spread of Christianity. Over the centuries, the gospel message has been vilified and ridiculed. Roman rulers threw first-century Christians to the lions, and 20th-century dictators sent believers to prison camps. It is estimated that 70 million Christians have been martyred since the church began—and 40 million of those were in the 20th century. Yet today Christianity has more adherents than any religion, and numbers are growing in many parts of the world. Our faith is spreading because it is the truth—and history shows that when this truth is mocked and scorned, it actually spreads faster!
6. Jesus. The most amazing thing about God is not that He exists, but that He loved us so much He was willing to send His Son to earth to save us from ourselves. Jesus was with the Father from the time of creation, and His arrival was predicted numerous times in Old Testament prophecy. Finally He interrupted history and came to live among us. His crucifixion is historical fact, and His resurrection was verified by hundreds of witnesses. The man who perhaps knew Jesus best—the apostle John—saw the risen Christ and touched His nail-pierced hands. He wrote, “What we have seen and heard we proclaim to you” (1 John 1:3). Jesus is not an illusive fairy tale. He is the living, breathing, touchable Son of God.
7. My personal friendship with God. Atheists may not be convinced that God exists after listening to a storm, smelling a hibiscus or reading the Bible. When I am asked to defend my faith, I don’t start an intellectual argument. I have to go back to the words of Paul in 2 Timothy 1:12: “I am not ashamed; for I know whom I have believed.”
There are many reasons I am convinced God is real (the existence of coffee alone proves that He loves me!), but the best evidence is how He forgave me, changed me and put unexplainable joy in my heart. And I can prove that.

[quote author=DemonWars link=topic=665322.msg4448966#msg4448966 date=1410278781]
Okay three things:
1: What in whatever god you promote’s name is a “satanite”? sounds like a ore to me.
2: Make me.
3: Cunt.
[/quote]you are polluting my spirit, be gone idiot

Yes earth is 6000 years old and everything orbits earth because that’s what a book said written by a human
[/quote]god wrote the book not humans smh…

I’m a man of faith as well, but if I’m correct, I believe his disciples wrote the Bible, not God.

[/quote]he worded it to them m8…

I am aware that a lot of wording in the Bible is the word of God and Jesus Christ, but that does not change the fact that God didn’t write the Bible. It doesn’t matter what religious views you have, but you must understand that such a vital piece of information that contributes to Christianity in such a vast way, or any religion for that matter, is up for analysis, simply because it was written by human beings. If you are truly a follower of your religion, however, this should not change your faith, because that lies within you.

You are trying to have a logical discussion with a 13 year old simple minded believer (i don’t mean that all believers are simple minded, but this guy obviously is.)[/quote]You clearly are insinuating that being a believer means I’m an idiot, well I’ve put forth very valid and respective points in the OP. It’s not my fault if your athiesm means that you can’t read or write well, pagan.

item.title: God is real
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

Thread is obvious troll but let me ask you, what good has religion done to us? More specifically Christianity? Not saying you shouldn’t practice religion, feel free to do whatever you please but don’t try and shove it in other peoples throats.

Bashing other peoples beliefs and sexuality, killing in name of God. Not exactly following the Bible now is it.

In place of the Old Testament law, we are under the law of Christ (Galatians 6:2), which is to “love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind…and to love your neighbor as yourself” (Matthew 22:37-39). If we obey those two commands, we will be fulfilling all that Christ requires of us: “All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments” (Matthew 22:40).

Read full topic

item.description:

I’m not planning on following a religion that says that if you murder a family, you can have the virgin daughters to do with as you please.

Edit: all of your arguments have been explained by science.
Don’t ask athiests to prove that god doesn’t exist.
We simply don’t believe that he exists for a lack of proof.
The burden of proof is on the side making the claim.
I can claim that there is a invisable dragon in my house, try to prove me wrong.
[/quote]you dont have a invisable dragon in your house because being invisable is not a thing… god is real youre just an idiot

Okay you just made my day…

EDIT: So, a magic man in the skies, that created a whole unniverse within 7 days sounds more like a “thing” to you?
And how can you prove me wrong?
Maybe god contacted me and wanted me to tell people that religion these days is bullshit.
You don’t know.

EDIT2: Again, the burden of proof is on the party that claims god is real.
So prove it to me that he exists, and i will believe.
[/quote]its a belief because you either believe in it or you dont
proof is there bro ur just too dumb to see

you called it a belief but then said people are dumb if they didn’t see proof of GOD meaning you know proof?
I think your a little ill minded if your the one calling other people dumb for not knowing proof about a fake man people used purely for control and for power.

enjoy.
[/quote]are you mad you little shithead, you capitalizing god means that you too are afraid of his might
/thread
gtfo nonbelievers

Is this kid serious?..
Well i didn’t expect anything less from a 13 year old kid who names himself pure_ ~
Where did you mean that Capatilizing a name mean’s you’re afraid of them?
That’s a part of human psychology class i missed~
You realise that you made a post about claiming that god is real, and then coming up with reasons that aren’t even proof of his existence, only the things you feel as though are from him and that reinforce YOUR idea of his existence.
And when we come up with arguments on why we think your arguments are bullshit, you say “well i don’t have to prove it”.
Are you sure you’re not 6?[/quote]Kid, your name is demon wars, are you a satanite? What kind of idiot promotes the battle of demons, you filthy heaven. GTFO my thread now.

  1. The global spread of Christianity. Over the centuries, the gospel message has been vilified and ridiculed. Roman rulers threw first-century Christians to the lions, and 20th-century dictators sent believers to prison camps. It is estimated that 70 million Christians have been martyred since the church began—and 40 million of those were in the 20th century. Yet today Christianity has more adherents than any religion, and numbers are growing in many parts of the world. Our faith is spreading because it is the truth—and history shows that when this truth is mocked and scorned, it actually spreads faster!

The only reason why Christianity spread worldwide was because there are always weak people (aka sheep) who need to be guided. The strong, who can think for themselves, get further because they are humping their wives instead of the bible.

No.
